auto_merge.commit_title: Add an option to runtests to run with a specific Limited API version (#6917)

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: I don't propose using this on the CI (there's just too many combinations to test) but I think it's a useful thing to be able to do locally.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
        help=("Use CPython's Limited API. "
              "Accepts an optional API version in the form '3.11', otherwise uses current."))
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2447,8 +2449,8 @@ def main():
         "--no-capture", dest="capture", default=True, action="store_false",
         help="do not capture stdout, stderr in srctree tests. Makes pdb.set_trace interactive")
     parser.add_argument(
-        "--limited-api", dest="limited_api", default=False, action="store_true",
-        help="Compiles Cython using CPython's LIMITED_API")
+        "--limited-api", dest="limited_api", nargs='?', default=False, const=True, action="store",
+        help="Compiles Cython using CPython's LIMITED_API. You can optional specify a version in the form '3.11'")

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
        "--limited-api", dest="limited_api", nargs='?', default='', const="%d.%d" % sys.version_info[:2], action="store",
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2447,8 +2449,8 @@ def main():
         "--no-capture", dest="capture", default=True, action="store_false",
         help="do not capture stdout, stderr in srctree tests. Makes pdb.set_trace interactive")
     parser.add_argument(
-        "--limited-api", dest="limited_api", default=False, action="store_true",
-        help="Compiles Cython using CPython's LIMITED_API")
+        "--limited-api", dest="limited_api", nargs='?', default=False, const=True, action="store",

comment_data.body: We do not support running the test runner in a different Python version than the tests (and I don't see a real incentive to implement that), so this seems a useless special case. Let's remove it and always generate the version string from the option value.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2733,9 +2735,26 @@ def runtests(options, cmd_args, coverage=None):
             refnanny = import_refnanny()
         CDEFS.append(('CYTHON_REFNANNY', '1'))
 
+    sys_version_or_limited_version = sys.version_info
     if options.limited_api:
-        CDEFS.append(('CYTHON_LIMITED_API', '1'))
-        CDEFS.append(("Py_LIMITED_API", '(PY_VERSION_HEX & 0xffff0000)'))
+        if options.limited_api is True:
+            CDEFS.append(("Py_LIMITED_API", '(PY_VERSION_HEX & 0xffff0000)'))
+        else:

commit.message:
Add an option to runtests to run with a specific Limited API version

I don't propose using this on the CI (there's just too many
combinations to test) but I think it's a useful thing to be
able to do locally.
Add back in documentation of forrmat
Only pass "deprecated" when it'll be understood

Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de>
